title: Matrix Multiplication
description:
Master matrix multiplication. Practice multiplying matrices of different dimensions and understand the row-by-column rule.

**Instructions:**
1. Multiply matrices A and B (2×3 × 3×2)
2. Multiply matrices B and C (3×2 × 2×1)
3. Verify that matrix multiplication is not commutative (A×B ≠ B×A)
4. Check the associative property: (A×B)×C = A×(B×C)

**Matrix A (2×3):**
```
[ 1  2  3 ]
[ 4  5  6 ]
```

**Matrix B (3×2):**
```
[ 7  8 ]
[ 9  10 ]
[ 11  12 ]
```

**Matrix C (2×1):**
```
[ 2 ]
[ 3 ]
```

**Matrix Multiplication Rule:**
For A×B = C, where A is m×n and B is n×p:
- C will be m×p
- C[i][j] = sum of (A[i][k] × B[k][j]) for k from 1 to n

**Important:** Matrix multiplication is NOT commutative!
hints: For A×B to be defined, columns of A must equal rows of B
Each element C[i][j] is dot product of row i from A and column j from B
Matrix multiplication is associative but not commutative
AB ≠ BA in general (even when both products are defined)
